candidates.name: Judith Hattie
candidates.why_elect: Safe communities—neighborhood support, victim support, civil defence, first aid first responder champions, street patrols. Health and well being—improve health access for the vulnerable, aged care, children, young mothers, unemployed, illiterate, prevention of suicide, community caring for community, community gardens reduce inequity.
candidates.why_stand: I will work with the people and other stakeholders in Waharoa to bring about a positive change and restore a strong sense of pride, leadership, self determination, a full participant in environmental well being, protection, progressive and economic growth and development for the area. Tihei Mauri Ora!

candidates.name: James Sainsbury
candidates.why_elect: I am motivated to serve on council by a desire to make Matamata a great place to live now and in the future. As a father to young children and a scientist I bring a diverse range of views and community connections to the decision making process.
candidates.why_stand: Matamata is my home and the place my wife and I are raising our children. We want Matamata to be the best it can be today, and in the future.

candidates.name: Kevin Tappin
candidates.why_elect: My family has lived in the Matamata district for over 100 years providing me with a wealth of knowledge on the history of Matamata. I now have 5 children, 4 step children, 24 grandchildren and 2 great grandchildren, giving me a huge investment in the future of Matamata.
candidates.why_stand: I maintain that the Matamata community deserves to be thriving, vibrant and alive, with residents living, working, using and playing in well maintained, fit for purpose facilities, with robust infrastructure. I believe our community deserves to be consulted on significant expenditure programmes and significant interest projects, eg The Petersen Fountain.
